column4: i was told to boot from the Live-CD, mount my installation and change kboot.conf from there, does that mean reinstalling ubuntu altogether, if not how do i do that?
so how do i do what i want to do
You boot... you openthe drive, you browse to the file, edit, save, and reboot :)
How do I get to the drive? I don't see it on the desktop
I'm going to PM you, ok?
ok but I don't think I can sned any PM's to you because I need to register or something
lol okay... look under Places - Computer
one sec my other computer is about 20 feet away so my responses may be delayed
OK I've found my kboot file and I can edit it but is there any way to install new kernel through my live cd?
Maybe... but don't try. why would you want to do that anyway?

because my ubuntu won't boot up and I think that it isn't just my kboot file that is the cause but I could try editting my kboot file and if that doesn't fix it then I could install a new kernel from the live cd?
Er.. no I don't think you can even do that.
I don't know what grub is but I think it's because my custom kernel changed sda1 to ps3sda1 and then the update manager's kernel changed it back to sda1
sorry I have to go eat dinner but will you be on in a half hour?
